title: league of legends using integrated graphics instead of gpu
body: I have recently upgraded motherboards and now league of legends is running from the integratd i7 graphics instead of my nvidia card. How can I fix this?

replies.body:
You should be able to resolve it by ensuring your dedicated GPU has the most up to date driver, then ensure your windows power settings are configured for [**'Best Performance'**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq6).

Let me know if this did the trick!

Yes it is. I also went into the nvidia control panel and added all instances of league of legends onto it. I ensured my cpu is set to best performance. However, the gpu uses directx 11 and my windows 10 uses directx 12. Could that be a problem?

No, directX is fairly backwards-compatible, so that shouldn't be a problem. Since you're still seeing issues, I'd like to escalate this to our tech team for further troubleshooting. I'd like you to run some system logs with our [**Hextech Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) then attach them to a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). One of our specialists will reach back out as soon as possible.

Let me know if you ran into any issues.

I found the issue. It was quite funny actually. I recently upgraded my CPU to an i7 4770 3.4GHz, but it was clocked at 700Hz for some reason. When I put it back to a normal clock, the game ran fine. Thanks, I'm plat 2 now! Here's to diamond!
